meanings.definition: To give a tangible or visible form to something.
meanings.sent1: The artist will imbody her emotions into the painting.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor will imbody the essence of nature in the statue.
meanings.sent3: It would be interesting to imbody music into a sculpture.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful movements imbody the spirit of a dancer.
meanings.sent5: The story will imbody the magic of a faraway land.

meanings.sent1: The hero in the story will imbody courage and bravery.
meanings.sent2: The wise owl imbodying wisdom is a common symbol.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing to see a cat trying to imbody a lion.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter imbodies the joy of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The old tree imbodies the wisdom of centuries.

meanings.sent1: The recipe will imbody the flavors of different spices.
meanings.sent2: The new design will imbody elements of traditional architecture.
meanings.sent3: It's funny to see how he tries to imbody all the latest trends.
meanings.sent4: Her speech will imbody the hopes and dreams of the community.
meanings.sent5: The painting will imbody the beauty of the changing seasons.
